utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you want to tell me what brought you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so for the past two days I I've I've noticed that I can't smell things as well, as I used to be able to smell them and I seem to have lost my sense of taste as well. And I have this mild dry cough. I'm just worried it's covid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. You said for a couple days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, for two days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you ever had anything like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, nothing like this.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, when you say you feel like you've lost sense of taste and smell, is it totally gone or do you taste a little bit? Or how? How is that working for you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The smell isn't totally gone I can still smell something if it smells really really bad and and then and then I can taste really, really salty foods, but I can taste normal things like I can't taste of banana.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, is that been pretty consistent throughout the last couple of days or is it on and off?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been pretty consistent, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And did this dry cough that start at the same time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And when you say sorry, you said mild cough, and I my next question was do you feel like it's a dry cough or you producing any sputum? Any blood? Or is it to not, not bringing up anything?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has that gotten worse over the last couple of days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The dry cough? Um it's been pretty consistent as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK is there, have you done anything to try to make it better? Have you taken any over the counter medications or?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't tried anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Have you had, in addition to these symptoms, have you had any fevers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Fevers, no fevers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any difficulty breathing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, no headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any chills or night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any muscle ache or general weakness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so generally it seems like you're pretty well other than this loss of taste slash smell and the dry cough that correct,

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and then recently have you been in contact with anyone that's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no not that I can remember or yeah, not that I can remember.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I went hiking with my partner two weeks ago. I guess there were some people who kind of brushed by us, but other than that I don't see where else I could have gotten this from.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, was that hiking somewhere close by?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it was like half an hour from where we are.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are your immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and can you think of any for this dry cough, just a circle back to that. Can you think of anything that triggers it? It's called the cold or being around certain things like cats or dogs or any other environmental things?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any chest pain? Thats the other thing . I'm not sure if I asked you .

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No no chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And in terms of your general health, do you? Do you have any chronic conditions that you live with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you take any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you ever had any surgery or been hospitalized for another reason?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any family history of respiratory problems, cancers or heart problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And just in terms of free lifestyle, so do you live with family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you read along with a partner or roommate?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with my parents and my younger sibling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And is that in town here?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And in general, do you eat a healthy diet? Do you exercise?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I I have drank alcohol before but not not regularly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um. And I do use marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I have taken edibles before but also not very regularly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any other drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you currently in high school?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yes, I am in my last year of high school.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how is that going?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Pretty good, yeah, we're doing things online now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So you haven't really been out of the house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Uhm I think that's all my questions for now. Uh I definitely like to get you a covid test just because your symptoms are consistent with some common covid symptoms. So basically that means that we would do a swab. It might not come back for a day or two. You definitely have to self isolate between now and when you get the results back, potentially even if it's negative, longer, if you're still having symptoms.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Otherwise, there probably. There might be a couple other tests we want to do. We might have more questions when we come back, we'll go over this with the doctor that I'm working with today, but just wanted to give you a heads up of what to expect next. Did you have anything else you wanted to tell me that I didn't ask you about or any questions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, uh thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, well thanks for coming in today. Will definitely get you taken care of shortly.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
